eligibility.title: Eligibility
details: Healthy volunteers of age group between 18-65 years of age, weight at least 45 kg and Hb of at least 12.5grams can donate blood.
Healthy males can donate blood once in three months and women once in four months.
A donor shall not do any type of donation within 12 months after a bone marrow harvest and within 6 months after a peripheral stem cell harvest.
Pregnant women or recently delivered mother should be deferred for 12 months after delivery.
People with HIV/AIDS, syphilis and hepatitis, and injected with drugs at any point of life, must never give blood.

benefits.title: Benefits
details: Help get rid of negative feelings
Provide a sense of belonging and reduce isolation

precautions.title: Before
points: Make sure your Hb in within normal range.
Eat iron-rich diet like beans, spinach, fish, and cereals.
Have a sound sleep and drink lots of fluids.
No alcohol should be consumed before the donation day.
Stop taking blood thinning medication before 2-3 days, if any.

precautions.title: On the day
points: Drink extra water or non-alcoholic drink before donation.
Avoid fatty food like fries, burger etc.
Take all prescriptions or medications with you, if any.
Wear a shirt with loose sleeves that can be rolled up the elbows easily.
Talk to other donors or staff and relax.

precautions.title: After
points: Keep bandage on the area of prick for next several hours.
Keep sitting for few minutes after donating blood.
Do not do any strenuous exercise like weight lifting for the rest of the day.
In case of dizziness, lie down until you feel better.
Keep taking iron-rich diet to replace the lost iron store from body.
